metadata.Title: CVE-2020-1935 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.Description: In Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.30, 8.5.0 to 8.5.50 and 7.0.0 to 7.0.99 the HTTP header parsing code used an approach to end-of-line parsing that allowed some invalid HTTP headers to be parsed as valid. This led to a possibility of HTTP Request Smuggling if Tomcat was located behind a reverse proxy that incorrectly handled the invalid Transfer-Encoding header in a particular manner. Such a reverse proxy is considered unlikely.

criterions.comment: tomcat9 package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.0.31-1').
